Hi Zara,

Yes, 

1) If you do a OW search and copy the whole url including the query string you can just use that

I pretty sure for the events search it's currently ?age=openweekend (which actually caused a search for events on the OW weekend rather than explicitly just OW events; I dont' think we flag them separately)
http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/upcoming-events/index.php?age=openweekend 

2) If you want to setup a redirect url to point to that you can ie. http://www.london2012.com/openweekendevents you do this via the shorturls interface http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/shorturls/

But you can't select that URL in the CMS via the link picker you'll need to type or cut/pate the whole URL in each time.

3) We do have some SEO work in the pipeline for Andy to allow us to store 'Canned searches' and deal with them in a nice way but it won't be in place in time for Open Weekend.

Hoep that answers your question

Jamie

Liz

The way it's supposed to work is that jpgs are ftped to our dedicated ftp server along with an associated XML file.

We (i.e. a cms feed) periodically (hourly) check the server and pull off any files that we find there.

Example of XML file attached.

Thanks!

Is it going to a Kitsite FTP server or a media manager one? That is, for the Games will they need to send it to a new place, or can it stay where it is, and D3 just tap into its existing location?

Hi Liz,

No, we simply based our parser on a couple of sample feeds / emails.

Below is an overview of how it works and some sample files, although I would strongly advise going back to Getty for the final word on this (we are still having issue ourselves with the way images are delivered after 3 years of bedding in; which seems to be down to how the images are actually sent form MediaManager). 

There was talk of a proper webservices API being available in the near future when we first built this, so it may be worth seeing if that is available yet. As it would be a far better route to integration with MediaManger that the current method of FTP server + XML files + matching up .jpg of filenames and then cleaning up the folder structure once file have been retrieved.

These are our two most recent contacts at Getty.
Patrick Stewart <patrick.stewart@gettyimages.com>
Samuel Melo <Samuel.Melo@gettyimages.com>

Jamie

1) Top level / date folders

When an image is sent form Getty Media Manager to the the FTP server (btw this is a KS managed server) a date stamped folder is created with the following format /2011-006-15T11_04_24Z/ 
 

 
 
2) Each image individual delivery and sample XML

For each image an .xml file is sent along with a corresponding .jpg image, both will be stored in the current day's folder.

10525_ODA_MDA_DT_119_HI.JPG.xml
110525_ODA_MDA_DT_119_HI.jpg 

3) XML file format 

An example file is attached:



<gyi:value name="CMS Title">The Basketball Arena's coloured seats represent a basketball</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="CMS image caption">Construction is complete on the Basketball Arena. The 12,000 black and orange seats have been designed to represent the colours of a basketball.</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="GYI_KEYWORDS">110525_ODA_MDA_DT_119.TIF</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="GYI_KEYWORDS">Basketball Arena</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="GYI_KEYWORDS">seating</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="Olympic Sport">Basketball</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="Venue">Basketball Arena</gyi:value>
<gyi:value name="Date Photo Taken">2011-06-09</gyi:value>


4) What happens if the same file is sent more than once

The filenames of sent assets and corresponding xml files will appear with a suffix - a number in brackets - when sent multiple times, simultaneously or consecutively. Here are some screenshots to illustrate:
 
* Note: the filename in the XML file (IIRC) [ <gyi:value name="Filename">110525_ODA_MDA_DT_119_HI.JPG</gyi:value> ] does not take into account the sequence number in brackets nor the case of the .jpg extension (in the XML it is represented as .JPG but on the filesystem it is .jpg).

- Delivery 1
 

 
 
- Delivery 2
 

 
 
- Delivery 3

Thanks, Jamie. We’ll need to pick this up with Media Manager and with Deltatre – useful to know that we’ll need to switch off of your FTP, anyway, so maybe there is a chance to get a proper API in place...

comments.value: Kieran, can you give me a quick breakdown of the work you have completed on registration so far with the time spent on it along with your estimate of the work you still plan to do (again with estimates) - thanks.

We quoted 10 days, as I recall.
It's difficult to say exactly how much time I have spent on it so far, on account of other distractions.
However, I spent, most of last week, plus most of this week (albeit only 2.5 days - actually three days as I worked into the night on wed/thur).
So, thus far, I would estimate I've spent 6 days doing the following:
 * Make amendments to the Community library (the frontend php library) to facilitate the simpler registration procedure (double-opt-in, but no password requirement).
 * Make amendments to the CMS to facilitate the above
 * Created a dev "festival" site, and implemented some html/php in order to test the above.
 * Extensive testing on dev.
 * Amended the live 2012 landing page (where you end up when you click on your validation email) in order to work with the above functionality.
 * Created festival2012 client and set it up with the new community procedures.
 * Uploaded the festival html (from cogapp) and amended to work with 2012's fieldnames. (NB uploading the templates isn't really part of this task, but it was a prerequisite in order to test properly).

Still to do:
Approx four days:
 * Write a feed to send emails to people who amend their details via the festival site. ("You recently logged in and changed your details, we;re just checking that you really meant to do this").
 * Further testing and inevitable tweaks.

Complicated but bear with me!

It looks to me as if the options for the businessSizeOfOrganisation field were changed at some point. Here are the current values (and counts) from the db:

SHORT_TEXT                       COUNT(*)
------------------------------ ----------
-1                                      9
0-9                                  1213
10-19                                 248
100-499                               320
1000-2499                             118
20-99                                 391
2500+                                 279
3                                       1
500-999                                92
Between 10 and 50 people             8376
Between 50 and 250 people            5038
Less than 10 people                 11219
Over 250 people                      7096
Select                                  5

The options used to be:
  Less than 10 people
  Between 10 and 50 people
  Between 50 and 250 people
  Over 250 people   

They are now:
  0-9
  10-19
  20-99
  100-499
  500-999
  1000-2499
  2500+

From this data it appears that no migration was done on the existing users.
This itself is not a big problem, HOWEVER, the following can cause a problem:

A user with one of the old values (e.g. "Between 50 and 250 people") returns to the site and goes to the edit-profile page. The "businessSizeOfOrganisation" select box can't find "Between 50 and 250 people" in the (new) list of valid options, and so NO value is selected in the select box.

This user then tries to save their profile but is then informed that they haven't filled in the "size of organisation" field.

What can we do?
Option 1. Make the "businessSizeOfOrganisation" checkbox do some kind of mapping from the old values to the new values, and select the most suitable "new" value.
Option 2. Migrate the data in the database.

Both options are hampered by the fact that there is not a 1-1 mapping between the old values and the new ones. If forced I guess we should maybe adopt:
  Less than 10 people  -> "0-9"
  Between 10 and 50 people -> "20-99"
  Between 50 and 250 people -> "100-499"
  Over 250 people   -> "500-999"
Marked as urgent.

Morag, 

the businessSizeOfOrganisation field were changed quite recently and there was no attempt to migrate the existing fields to the new values. This itself is not a big problem, however if a user with one of the old values (e.g. "Between 50 and 250 people") returns to the site and goes to the edit-profile page. The "businessSizeOfOrganisation" select box can't find "Between 50 and 250 people" in the (new) list of valid options, and so NO value is selected in the select box. We are applying a fix to this issue now.

Actually Kieran,
 
I was quite clear with LOCOG that this would be the case, namely that new users would have to re-enter the size of their organisation as their was no 1-1 mapping.

In fact I am not sure how this is a bug, it's just asking you to fill in a field, you may have completed it before but because the fields have changes we need new info (if this field is compulsory) you just need to re-enter it, in fact surely if you are editing your profile you will have changed other fields as well already.

If this was limited to business I'm not sure this is a major issue (although migrating would be nice but without a 1-1 mapping it may not even be perfectly achievable, maybe I am being a bit hard here). 

However  Morag's comment "It looks like ordinary sign ups are being asked for business data" is a bit more telling, I wonder if this is a mix of the issue above coming to light due to the issue Danny saw this morning.

ie. you sign up as a new user, but because (due to the SSL issue?) you are already logged in it thinks you are a business user and then asks you to correct a business field, even though you think you are just signing up as a *new* normal user.

What do we do?

- SSL : until this is fixed I think we are going to have a whole rash of these issues (made extra hard to debug due to the SSL issue). I think Danny said BT/Russ has a solution though?

- Migration : If you think we can migrate sensible, then maybe we should just propose to do that (doing it in the DB would be nicer).

- Existing users being sent to the new user register page (rather than being sent back to the login screen with a nice message) : maybe this is working and we're just not seeing it because of the SSL issue. Although as we are refactoring the whole registration system we probably do need to be sensible how much time we spend on this vs developing new screens.

Although saying all the above, Danny also just spotted the cause of the issue he was seeing, namely the business fields are only hidden in CSS so your autocomplete still tries to fill them out. I think I may have to look at actually hiding them in PHP today.

I think you're right that - in many ways - it is NOT actually a bug.
Although, as far as usability is concerned, it is not made clear to the user that "the values of the fields have changed, and so you need to go back and amend your business profile".

I have put in place the mapping that I suggested so that when "existing users with an OLD value for businessSizeOfOrganisation" return to the site, their businessSizeOfOrganisation field is silently migrated to one of the NEW values, according to the following mapping:

Less than 10 people -> "0-9"
Between 10 and 50 people -> "20-99"
Between 50 and 250 people -> "100-499"
Over 250 people -> "500-999"

As you say, this is arguably not really a bug but they probably won't see it as that!

Done. Returning business users are now silently migrated as follows:

  OLD VALUE -> NEW VALUE
  Less than 10 people -> "0-9"
  Between 10 and 50 people -> "20-99"
  Between 50 and 250 people -> "100-499"
  Over 250 people -> "500-999"

Am happy to revisit this if this is undesirable / incorrect.

There is another solution, which is to add the OLD value to the select box and select it.
This might be preferable.

subject: BSL player for Games Maker site
description:
I have had some feedback from BSL users that there is a problem with how we have implemented the BSL videos on the GM pages. They think the BSL clips should be placed next to the text so Deaf people will be able to either read or watch the clip rather on its own - in case the presenter on the clip is not being clear on some part so they could refer to the text and read to clarify.

I realise the clips have been set up as lightboxes but wonder if there is anything we can do to tweak the players and make them movable/draggable so people can reposition them. Grateful for your thoughts!

comments.value:
See below from my new (more technically minded colleague) Kavita. Is this something we can do anything about?

From: Kavita Kapoor
Sent: 24 January 2011 10:13
To: Morag Reavley
Subject: small but potential security risk

Hi Morag

When looking at the CMS and London2012 I noticed that we show the following link to the user   http://www.london2012.com/index.php

As a hacker one immediately knows this is a PHP site and can use that a starting point to exploit vulnerabilities.

As it is an easy change on most web servers we should really change this.

Let me know if you need me to follow up

Kavita



Kavita Kapoor
New Media Team

Mobile: 0754 5092441

Switchboard: +44 (0)20 3 2012 000
Fax: +44 (0) 203 2012 001
www.london2012.com

P Please consider the environment before printing this email

We are in fact in the process of changing many of the URLs on the site. See #2103. The php extension will be disappearing from the paths of index pages over the course of the next few weeks. 

On the other hand, although we have no current plans to change the page extension, it is something that could be done if desired, by reconfiguring the Apache configuration file and the CMS. I am not entirely sure if there are likely to be any nasty side effects or how much time we would need to make the change, but we can give you more detail if it's something you want to pursue.

While the existence of the ".php" extensions does theoretically make it easier for a hacker to discover that that the backend uses php, hiding the "index.php" filenames would not help hugely, without other - more onerous - changes.
Every other page on the site has a .php extension
 e.g. http://www.london2012.com/news/2011/01/over-820-000-awarded-to-artists-for-cultural-olympiad-pr.php
to "hide" all of these .php extensions would require quite a lot of work, for an arguably negligible amount of security.
The proposer of this change did - indeed - note this is only a "small" security risk. Which it is. It is a sensible suggestion, but one which could not be implement without quite a significant amount of work on our part.
Briefly one solution would be to make all of the extensions ".html" but that would require a significant amount of recoding (of both backend, AND frontend code).
I don't have a precise estimate to hand, without carrying out further investigation, but it would be of a similar order of magnitude as the SEO paths project.
As Danny says, please ask us if it's something you want any more detail on.

Thank you for this!

I will review with Jagdeep here and we’ll get back to you regarding how important this is.

My personal opinion is that security is best dealt with by keeping the version of PHP/Apache you are running up to date and not relying on obfuscation !!

That aside, there are couple issues here:

- all the internal references in the CMS (and in href's in HTML pages) are to .php pages (we'd need to update the default extension on all templates, update all filenames, update all hardcoded paths in templates and then bulk publish everything, hoping nothing broke)
- all the pages are currently indexed in Google and externally with .php extensions so we'd need to do some serious fancy url rewriting to deal with those.
- real .html pages will be parsed as PHP pages although this shouldn't cause any issues, some thought would need to be taken around this.

Kavita is right that it would be easy (on a new site) to publish all pages as .html and then tell Apache to run all pages (with .html or .php) though the PHP interpreter (*) but as we currently have a huge number of pages in various search engine indexes and various inbound links the migration would be far from trivial.
